originalTitle: Nigeria denies report it paid 'huge' ransom to free pupils in mass abduction
title: Happy News: Children Are Safe in Nigeria!
content:
Hello from Africa!

Hello, amazing friends! Welcome to your special news report from our wonderful continent, Africa! My name is your Africa Reporter, and I'm here to share some important news with you today. We're going to talk about a story from a big country called Nigeria. It's a country with many, many people and lots of sunshine, just like where you are!

A Scary Day at School

Imagine going to school one sunny morning. You're excited to learn and play with your friends. You might have your backpack ready, maybe a sandwich for lunch. Well, some children in a school in Nigeria had a very, very scary day like this. One day, not too long ago, some bad people came to their school. They took many children away from their classrooms. Can you imagine how scared the children must have felt? And how sad and worried their mummies and daddies were? Everyone felt very, very sad. Their parents missed them terribly. Everyone in Nigeria, and even people in other parts of the world, wished for the children to come back home. It's a very sad thing when children are not safe at school. School is supposed to be a place where you feel safe and happy, where you learn and grow. Did you know? Nigeria is one of the biggest countries in Africa! It has over 200 million people, which is more than many other countries put together! It's famous for its music, movies, and delicious food.

Happy News: Children Come Home!

But here is the very best news! The grown-ups in charge of Nigeria, like the President and many brave helpers, worked very, very hard. They did everything they could to find the children and bring them back. And guess what? All the children came back home safely to their families! Yes, every single child! Everyone was so happy. There were big smiles, lots of hugs, and happy tears. Their mummies and daddies were so relieved to hold their children close again. It was a wonderful day when they came back. This is the most important part of our story today: the children are safe!

What is 'Ransom'?

Now, let's learn a new word. It's called 'ransom'. It's not a happy word, but it's important to understand. Sometimes, when bad people take someone away, they ask for a lot of money to let that person go. This money is called 'ransom'. It's like saying, "Give us money, and we will give you the person back." It's a bad thing because it encourages bad people to do more bad things. Governments usually don't like to pay ransom because they want to stop bad people from thinking they can always get money this way. Did you know? Most children in Africa love to go to school, just like you! They learn to read, write, and count, and dream about what they will be when they grow up. Teachers work very hard to help them learn.

Nigeria Says 'No Money!'

After the children came home, some people started to say things. They whispered that the government of Nigeria had paid a 'huge' amount of money, a very big ransom, to the bad people to get the children back. But the government of Nigeria, the leaders of the country, said "No! That is not true!" They said they did not pay any money to the bad people. They said they used other ways, very clever ways, to make sure the children were set free and returned home safely. They want everyone to know that they didn't give money to the bad people. This is important because it tells bad people that they won't get money if they do bad things like taking children from school. They want to show that they can bring children back safely without making deals with bad people. It means they want to make sure such a thing does not happen again and that bad people do not get what they want. It is a way of showing strength and care for all the children in the country.

The Big Police Boss

In every country, there are brave police officers who help keep everyone safe. They wear special uniforms and have special cars. They help people when they are in trouble. In Nigeria, there is a very, very important person who is the leader of all the police officers. He is like the big boss of all the police in the whole country! His special name is the Inspector-General of Police. That's a very long name, so let's just call him 'the big police boss'. He is in charge of making sure all the police officers do their job well and keep everyone safe from danger. Did you know? Police officers are real-life superheroes! They help find lost children, stop bad people, and make sure traffic flows safely. They are always ready to help!

Why Did He Leave His Job?

Now, something else happened after the children came home safely. The big police boss decided to leave his important job. He was supposed to stay in his job for a little bit longer, for another whole year! But he chose to leave earlier than he had planned. We don't know exactly why he decided to leave. Sometimes, grown-ups make big decisions about their jobs. It might have been his own choice, or maybe he felt it was time for someone new to take over. It happened not long after the happy news that all the children were back home. When a big boss leaves their job, someone new will come in to take their place. This new person will then become the big leader of all the police and continue the important work of keeping everyone safe in Nigeria. It's a big change, but it's part of how countries work. New leaders come, and new ideas can help make things even better.

Keeping Everyone Safe

The most important thing for all grown-ups, especially governments, is to keep children safe. It's their job to make sure schools are safe places to learn and play. It's their job to make sure that no bad people can harm children. This story reminds us that even when scary things happen, there are many good people working hard to make things right. The children are home, and that's the biggest victory! Everyone wants to make sure that children can go to school feeling happy and secure, without any worries. Did you know? School safety is a big topic all over the world. Grown-ups are always thinking of new ways to make schools super safe for children, like having fences, special gates, and kind teachers who look out for everyone.

Our Hope for the Future

So, our news from Africa today tells us a story with a happy ending for the children who were taken. They are back home, safe with their families. The government says they found a way to bring them back without paying bad people. And the big police boss changed his job. All these things show that people are working hard in Nigeria to keep everyone safe and make sure children can go to school without fear. We hope for a future where all children in Africa, and all over the world, can learn and play happily, every single day! Stay safe and keep learning, amazing friends! That's all for today from your Africa reporter!
summary: In Nigeria, children who were taken from their school are now safely back home, and the government says they did not pay money to get them back, while the big police chief has left his job.
whyMatters: This is important because it shows that children's safety is very important, and governments work hard to protect them and make sure schools are safe places to learn. It also shows that paying money to bad people is usually avoided so that bad things don't happen again.

title: Police Ask Questions to a Very Important Person From Far Away!
content:
Hello wonderful children of Africa! Your friendly news reporter is here with some important news from far, far away. We are going to talk about a grown-up called Mr. Peter Mandelson. It might sound like a big story, but we'll explain it in a super simple way, just for you!

A Special Job: Being an Ambassador

Imagine someone who works for their country, like a special helper, in another country. Their job is to make friends and help their country talk to other countries. This special helper is called an ambassador! Mr. Peter Mandelson used to have a very important job like this. He was an ambassador for a country called the United Kingdom, and he worked in another big country called the United States of America. That's a very long way from Africa! Think of it like being a representative for your family in a big meeting. You speak for them and make sure everyone understands each other. That's what an ambassador does, but for a whole country! Mr. Mandelson was a very well-known and important person because of his job. Did you know? There are ambassadors from many African countries all over the world, helping their countries make friends and work together!

Police are Asking Questions

Sometimes, even very important people need to talk to the police. The police are the grown-ups who help keep everyone safe and make sure everyone follows the rules. They are like the superheroes of our communities! Recently, the police asked Mr. Peter Mandelson to come and talk to them. This is what we call being 'arrested'. Being arrested doesn't always mean someone is guilty right away. It means the police think something might have happened, and they need to ask lots of questions to find out the truth. They are investigating, which means they are like detectives, gathering clues and listening to what people say. They wanted to ask Mr. Mandelson about something called 'alleged misconduct'. This just means they *think* he might have done something wrong, but they are not sure yet. It's like when your teacher asks you about a broken crayon – they are trying to figure out what happened. Did you know? Police officers wear special uniforms and often drive special cars with flashing lights! They work very hard to keep us all safe.

Who Was Jeffrey Epstein? (Important to Know About Safety)

Now, this part is very important for you to understand, especially about staying safe. The police are asking Mr. Mandelson questions because they think he might be connected to a person called Jeffrey Epstein. Jeffrey Epstein was a very, very bad grown-up. He did terrible, horrible things to young people and children. Because of this, he got into very big trouble. It is super, super important for all children to know that grown-ups should ALWAYS protect children. Grown-ups should make sure children are safe, happy, and healthy. Jeffrey Epstein did the opposite, and that is why he was such a bad person. Did you know? If a grown-up ever makes you feel unsafe, uncomfortable, or tells you to keep a secret that makes you feel bad, you MUST tell another trusted grown-up right away! Your safety is the most important thing.

Why Are We Talking About This?

This story is important because it shows that no matter how important someone is – even if they were an ambassador or a very famous person – everyone must follow the rules. And if the police think someone has done something wrong, they will ask questions to find out the truth. This is called justice. Justice means everyone is treated fairly, and everyone is kept safe. It also reminds us that when bad things happen, like what Jeffrey Epstein did, we need to make sure we understand how to protect ourselves and others. Every child deserves to feel safe and loved, no matter where they are in the world, including right here in our wonderful Africa. Did you know? Justice systems around the world try to make sure that people who do bad things are stopped and that those who have been hurt get help.

What Happens Next?

After the police ask questions, they will look at all the information they have gathered. They will listen to what everyone says and try to put all the pieces of the puzzle together. This is a very careful and thorough process. They want to make sure they find the real truth. It can take some time, just like when you're trying to solve a tricky puzzle! If the police find enough clues that someone might have done something wrong, then the case might go to a special place called a court. In court, even more grown-ups will listen to the evidence and decide what happened. It's all about making sure that the right decisions are made and that everyone is treated fairly under the law.

Your Safety is Super Important!

Remember, children, your safety is the most important thing in the world. Always know that there are many, many good grown-ups who love you and want to protect you. These are your trusted adults. Who are your trusted adults? They are your parents, guardians, grandparents, teachers, aunties, uncles, or any other grown-up you feel safe with and can talk to. If you ever feel scared, worried, or if someone makes you feel uncomfortable, please, please, please tell a trusted adult right away. No secret is so big that you can't tell a trusted grown-up. They are there to listen to you, help you, and keep you safe. You are never alone, and your voice is very powerful! Did you know? You have a voice, and it's important! Telling a trusted adult when you need help is a brave thing to do.

Why This Matters for All of Us

This story, even though it's about grown-ups far away, reminds us about important things like fairness, truth, and keeping children safe everywhere. It shows that the rules apply to everyone, and that justice is important for all people. It also reminds us that we all have a part to play in making the world a safer place, by being kind, looking out for each other, and always speaking up if something doesn't feel right. So, my little super-reporters, remember to stay curious, stay kind, and always remember to talk to your trusted adults. That’s all for today’s big news. Keep smiling and shining brightly!
summary: Police in a country far away are asking questions to an important grown-up, Mr. Peter Mandelson, because they think he might be connected to a very bad person named Jeffrey Epstein, who hurt young people; this story reminds us that everyone must follow rules and children's safety is super important.
whyMatters: This matters because it shows that even very important people are asked questions if the police think they did something wrong, and it teaches us that children's safety is the most important thing and you should always tell a trusted grown-up if you feel unsafe or worried.

originalTitle: Indonesia mosque gives out 3,800 free meals every night of Ramadan
title: Super Sharing: A Mosque's Amazing Kindness!
content:
Hello, my super friends from Africa! Get ready for a happy story from far away. Today, we are going to learn about some very kind people. They live in a country called Indonesia. It is a beautiful place with many islands, green trees, and lovely beaches. Our story is about a special building called a mosque. This mosque is doing something super amazing! It is helping so many people every single night. Let's find out more about this wonderful act of sharing and kindness! It will make your heart feel warm and happy.

What is Ramadan? A Special Time to Share!

Do you know what Ramadan is? It is a very special time for many people around the world who are Muslim. It is like a big, happy celebration for them. During Ramadan, people try to be extra good. They pray a lot and think about how they can help others and be thankful for what they have. One big part of Ramadan is called "fasting." This means people do not eat or drink during the day. They do this from when the sun comes up until the sun goes down. It helps them feel closer to God. It also helps them understand how people who don't have enough food might feel every day. When the sun sets, it is time to break the fast! This evening meal is called "Iftar." It's a joyful time when families and friends gather. They eat yummy food together. And guess what? Sharing food with others is a very important part of Ramadan. It shows love and kindness to everyone. **Did you know?** Ramadan happens once every year. The dates change a little bit each year, like a moving party! It's a time for lots of joy and family.

The Jogokariyan Mosque: A Place of Kindness

Now, let's talk about our special mosque in Indonesia. It is called the Jogokariyan Mosque. A mosque is a holy place where Muslim people go to pray. It's like a church or a temple, but for Muslims. Mosques are often very beautiful buildings with tall towers. They are places for people to meet, learn, and help each other in their community. The Jogokariyan Mosque is not just a place for prayers. It is also a place with a very big heart! Every night during Ramadan, this mosque becomes a super busy kitchen. Imagine a giant party where everyone gets a yummy meal for free! That's what happens at this mosque. They give out thousands and thousands of free meals to people. People from all around come to get food. It's a wonderful example of giving and caring for neighbours. They make sure nobody feels left out during this special time. **Did you know?** In many African countries, mosques also play a big role in communities. They help people and share food, especially during special times like Ramadan! It's a worldwide act of kindness.

So Many Meals! So Much Food!

How many meals do they give out? Hold your breath! They give out about 3,800 free meals every single night! Wow, that's a lot of food! To help you imagine how many, 3,800 meals is like feeding all the children in many, many schools! Or enough food for a really, really big village every single night. Each meal is packed with yummy food. There is often rice, tasty chicken, fresh vegetables, and sometimes even sweet treats like cakes or fruits. It's all prepared with lots of love and care, so it tastes extra delicious! People come to the mosque as the sun starts to go down. They wait excitedly to get their delicious food. Some people eat their meals right there, sharing happy chatter with friends. Others take the food home to their families to enjoy together. It's a very happy and special time for everyone who gets a meal. **Did you know?** The capital city of Indonesia is Jakarta. It's a very big and busy city, full of friendly people!

Who Helps Make This Happen?

You might be wondering, "Who cooks all this food?" And "Who helps give it out to everyone?" It's a team of super kind people! Many volunteers come to the mosque every day. Volunteers are people who help for free because they want to do good things for others. They have big hearts and happy smiles. These wonderful volunteers spend hours and hours cooking, packing, and serving the food. They chop fresh vegetables, stir giant pots of rice and stew, and carefully put each meal into a box or plate. It takes a lot of hard work and teamwork to feed so many people. But they do it with big smiles because they know they are helping their community. The people who get the food are very thankful. They appreciate the kindness and effort of everyone at the mosque. It shows that when we work together, we can do amazing things. Even a little help from many people can create something truly big and wonderful.

Why is Sharing Food So Important?

Sharing food is a special way to show love and care for others. When someone gives you food, it makes you feel warm and happy inside. It tells you that someone is thinking about you and wants to make sure you are okay. It makes you feel part of a big, caring family. During Ramadan, it's even more important to share. Many people want to help those who might not have enough food. They believe that by sharing, they are pleasing God and making the world a better, kinder place for everyone. It's a time to be generous and think about others. The Jogokariyan Mosque is a shining example of this kindness. They are making sure that no one in their community goes hungry during this special time. They are spreading happiness, one meal at a time. It's a beautiful way to show what community and faith are all about, bringing people closer together. **Did you know?** In many cultures around the world, sharing a meal is a sign of friendship and peace! Just like how we share food with our families and friends here in Africa, it makes bonds stronger.

A Message of Kindness from Far Away

So, my friends, this story from Indonesia teaches us something very important. It tells us that kindness is everywhere in the world. It shows us that when people come together to help others, wonderful things happen. We can all be part of this wonderful kindness! It doesn't matter where you live, whether it's in Indonesia or right here in Africa. We can all learn from the Jogokariyan Mosque. We can all try to be kind to our neighbours and help those around us. Maybe we can share our toys, help our parents with chores, or be nice to our friends when they are sad. Every little act of kindness makes a big difference. Just like 3,800 meals make a big difference for many families in Indonesia. Let's all try to be as kind and helpful as the people at the Jogokariyan Mosque! Keep shining your kindness, my friends! **Did you know?** "Ramadan Kareem" is a greeting people say during Ramadan, which means "Generous Ramadan" or "Have a blessed Ramadan"! It's a lovely way to wish happiness to others.
summary: In Indonesia, a kind mosque called Jogokariyan gives out 3,800 yummy free meals every night during the special time of Ramadan, showing how important it is to share and help others.
whyMatters: This story matters because it shows us that being kind and sharing with people who need help makes everyone happy and builds a strong, caring community, no matter where you live.

originalTitle: Prestianni trains at Bernabeu despite match ban over racism allegation
title: A Football Story: Training Time and Being Kind!
content:
Jambo, amazing friends! It's your kid-friendly news reporter, here from sunny Africa, ready to share another exciting story with you. Today, we're going to talk about football, big stadiums, and something very important: being kind to everyone. Let's dive in!

Meet Gianluca, the Speedy Winger!

Imagine you love playing football, running super fast, and helping your team score goals. That's a bit like Gianluca Prestianni! He's a young football player who plays for a team called Benfica. Benfica is a very famous team from a country far away called Portugal. Gianluca's job on the field is called a 'winger'. **Did you know?** A winger is like the speedy runner on the side of the football field. They dribble the ball very fast down the lines and try to send it to their teammates near the goal, or even score themselves! It's a very exciting position!

The Giant Stadium and a Big Game

Last Wednesday, Gianluca's team, Benfica, was going to play a really big game against another famous team called Real Madrid. This game was part of something super special called the Champions League. It's like the biggest football party for the best teams in Europe! The game was going to be played in Real Madrid's giant stadium, called the Bernabeu. Imagine a stadium so big, it can hold thousands and thousands of people all cheering at once! It's like a mountain of seats and noise! **Did you know?** Real Madrid's stadium, the Santiago Bernabeu, is one of the most famous football stadiums in the whole world! It's been home to many amazing football matches and champions.

A Time-Out for Gianluca

Now, here's the part where things got a little bit tricky for Gianluca. Even though his team was playing this super important Champions League game, he wasn't allowed to play in it. He was what we call 'provisionally banned'. This means the grown-ups in charge said, "Gianluca, you can't play in this game." It was like a temporary time-out from the big match. Why was he given a time-out? Well, it was because someone said he might have said something not kind to another person. This is called an 'allegation of racism'. Racism is when someone is treated badly or spoken to unkindly because of their skin colour, where they come from, or what they look like. It's very serious, and it's not fair at all to treat anyone like that. **Did you know?** 'Provisionally banned' means it's not a final decision yet. It's like when your teacher asks you to sit quietly for a few minutes while they figure out what happened. They are still checking all the facts to make sure everyone is treated fairly.

Training Even When You Can't Play

So, Gianluca couldn't play in the big game. That must have made him feel a little sad, right? Imagine your friends playing, and you have to watch from the side. But guess what he did? He still went to the stadium and trained with his teammates! Even though he knew he couldn't run onto the field and play in the match, he was there, running, kicking the ball, and practicing with everyone else. Why did he do that? Because being part of a team means sticking together! Even if you can't play in a game, it's important to stay fit, learn from your coaches, and be with your friends. It shows how dedicated he is to football and to his team. Training keeps your body strong and your mind ready for the next time you *can* play. **Did you know?** Football players train almost every day! They run, jump, practice shooting goals, and learn special tricks. It's how they get so good and strong, like the superheroes of the football field!

Standing Up for Kindness

This story reminds us of something very important: we should always be kind to each other. On the football field, in the classroom, or at home, treating everyone with respect is super important. No one should ever be made to feel sad or left out because of how they look or where they come from. Football is a game that brings people from all over the world together. It teaches us about teamwork, fair play, and respecting our opponents. When someone makes an allegation of racism, it's a reminder that we all need to work hard to make sure our world is a fair and friendly place for everyone. It's about playing fairly and being good people, on and off the field.

What Happens Next?

For Gianluca, the grown-ups will keep looking into what happened. They will listen to everyone and try to understand the situation fully. It takes time to make sure decisions are fair. For us, it's a chance to remember to always choose kindness and speak up if we see someone being treated unfairly. So, even with the time-out, Gianluca showed us that being a good team member means showing up and trying your best, no matter what. And for all of us, it's a big lesson in being kind and fair to every single person we meet. Keep shining bright, young champions, and always remember to spread kindness wherever you go! That's all for today from your African reporter. See you next time!
summary: Gianluca Prestianni, a young football player, trained with his team at a big stadium even though he couldn't play in an important game because grown-ups are looking into something serious about being fair and kind to everyone.
whyMatters: It matters because it shows that even when things are tough, players still need to practice and support their team, and it reminds us all to be kind and fair to everyone, no matter what they look like or where they come from.
